newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Afghan pilots said to defect with helicopter.
newsitem.headline: Afghan pilots said to defect with helicopter.

text.p: Three opposition pilots defected with a helicopter to Afghanistan's Taleban government on Saturday and landed at Kabul airport, a Taleban spokesman said.

Spokesman Mullah Wakil Ahmad, speaking to Reuters by telephone from the southern Afghan town of Kandahar, quoted the pilots as saying they had flown from Panjsher Valley, the stronghold of opposition guerrilla leader Ahmad Shah Masood north of Kabul, after offloading weapons they had brought from Tajikistan.
No independent account of the incident was available.

Ahmad said the pilots had told Taleban authorities in Kabul that they had flown weapons from Kulyab in northern Tajikistan, which, along with Russia and Iran, is often accused by the Taleban of helping the opposition factions.
He named the pilots as Mohammad Nadir, Gul Mohammad and Abdus Sabur.
